ratings.comment: I absolutely loved this class. The course material was super interesting, and Professor Harackiewicz was very passionate about it. However, know that if you do not read the textbook, you will not pass. The textbook chapters are fairly easy reads, so as long as you stay on top of it you should be fine! 10/10 would take this class again.

I love professor H, but her tests are not great. The wording is super specific and the answer options make you choose between two options that would both fit the question. you HAVE to read the textbook and take note of experiments. You're graded on three exams which is annoying as well. I liked this class but I definitely had to work for it.

It's harder than you think it'll be. 3 tests make up 90% of your grade. VERY TEXTBOOK HEAVY. Most psych classes textbook is kinda optional, but this class it is VERY ESSENTIAL. Go to her office hours and your TAs. If you show her that you care and are committed, she will help you out. Brought my grade up by two whole letters. She's funny and sweet.

Would not recommend. Content itself is interesting, grading system for this class is awful. No matter how much you study, her exams are really confusing, wordy, frustrating, difficult, etc. I'm a straight-A student and got 47% on the first exam. No other grades besides 3 exams and 1 paper, so her terrible bs exams are all your grade is based on.

This class is tough and requires effort. The material itself would be amazing if it were taught in a way the emphasized learning over test taking. I was told this was a good first psych class but it does require a lot of effort. I learned a lot and think it was valuable but I probably would not want another class with her again.

This class makes you question your knowledge of common sense, as everything you learn (which, by the way, is entirely out of the mandatory textbook) seems simple, but the tests are so specific that no matter how much you study the prof will throw in some stupid questions. Felt like she was tricking the students the whole time instead of teaching
I work for her in a research lab. She has been a great PI and an incredible resource. Haven't had her in any direct classes, but I would definitely recommend as a PI/head of lab.

Professor H is really nice, but her tests are hard. On top of that, they're the only thing you're graded on. There are four tests all semester, but she lets you drop the lowest score of the first three. There is no "final exam" in the way that it isn't cumulative, but she requires everyone to keep the score of their 4th exam. Overall good but hard.

Don't get too discouraged by my score for her. This class (social psychology) is tough but it's probably one of the most meaningful and useful classes I've ever taken here. You need to read the chapters at least twice to get a good sense for them. Her exams are difficult but definitely doable. IF YOU GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS SHE WILL HELP YOU STUDY!

Super interesting topic and incredibly kind and brilliant woman. However, the tests in this class are incredibly difficult. You have to READ THE BOOK!!!! and take solid lecture notes. The tests often test on little details or variations on concepts that make you think. I loved this class everyday besides the four exam days.

Really love this course. It's my first time feeling so reluctant to end a class and hoping to learn more!Social psychology is so interesting, Professor Harackiewics also lectures in an interesting way using different materials in class. And yes exams are tough, but if you read carefully you won't be so bad. Fair to test whether you studied or not.

Her exams seem to test on how well you can take an exam rather than how well you know the material.  Some trick questions in the 4, 70 multiple choice exams.  Professor H is a very nice woman and definitely knows her stuff but she is hard to meet with if you can't make it to her office hours! Overall a very interesting course.

If you think this class will be easy, it's not. I thought social psych wouldn't be a problem since the topic is interesting however the tests were very difficult. They didn't fairly test you on what you read and listened to in class. I felt like she was trying to trick students more than assess what they learned. Would not recommend.

Her exams are all details, no broad theory. You don't remember that one study that was referenced vaguely in one paragraph of the textbook? Sucks for you.  A good 13 of the questions have two perfectly plausible answers that evidence backs up, so you really have to just make a guess as to which one she wants you to put.

Her lectures are pretty redundant, she repeats a lot of the same info and elaborates on explanations of simple stuff.  Exams are extremely detail-oriented and tend to skip over some main concepts.. very frustrating.  She skips a lot of the book material in lecture but tests on it, so read.  Graded on a bell curve and T-scores, which sucks.

Judy's class was so incredible, I think everyone should take it!  Yes, the multiple choice exams can be tricky, and yes, you need to memorize the book for exams. Other than that, this is probably the most interesting class I've ever taken at Madison.  I did well on her tests, too, they're not THAT hard...

This class was a disappointment. From incessant reminders of "people do this because of culture" to other kinds of pseudo-academic, biased hand-waving, this class was mostly a waste of time. Shows so many videos, IMO, to make up for lack of rigorous content. The book is terrible, and they require a really new edition, so its really expensive.

Very interesting material! The prof knows her stuff but the exams are horrible. 4 exams but you get to drop the lowest score of the first 3 exams. Very detailed MC exams. Pretty much you have to know everything.

This class is the most useful class I took for my masters degree in a completely unrelated field. Social-psych is all around you and this prof demonstrates that with songs, movies and through the chapters in the book. Read the book carefully! Lots of exam questions are based on the text. Exams are tough because they're multiple choice.

Harackiewicz was a great professor.  The exams are only hard if you don't pay attention to the details.  She's really enthusiastic about the material, and it's all interesting.  The powerpoints are online, but sometimes she'll mention something in the lecture that will show up on the exam so it's good to attend.

Best professor I've had at UW. She's excited about the material, knows her stuff, and is referenced as doing research in the textbook. Textbook is easy to read and lectures are interesting. Exams are fine as long as you read the book. I actually looked forward to going to this class.

The lectures are pretty boring and she repeats the same material over and over, but she is very enthusiastic about the material.  You do not have to go to class much either since her powerpoints are online.  The exams are kind of rough, not too bad if you can remember details from the book though.

Another mediocre level 2 psych class-- unfair exam standards, dull lecture, etc. Only interesting part of class was video clips.Don't expect to do well on the exam unless you memorize your textbook- half of the questions come from chapters never mentioned in lecture.

I found this to be a very interesting class, and to be  actually applicable to the real world. Prof H. is very clear and keeps her lectures interesting, for being a power lecture. You can tell she is very enthusiastic of the material. She is helpful outside of class, and while the exams are difficult, if you study well, they are fine.

I took this class because the comments seemed fair enough. WRONG! She grades on a "t-score". Meaning whatever the mean of the class is becomes a C. I've had my raw score drop NINE points (and one letter) because of her scale. Plus, her exam questions can be extremely confusing where more than one seems right or none of them do! Avoid her.
Enthusiastic, clear, and helpful.  A bit slow at times but otherwise makes the material interesting.  Exam questions mostly from lecture with some from the text.

You could easily never go to class and do well - as long as you throughly read the book/look at her online powerpoints.  Knowing book material/details is key to doing well on tests.  If you pay attention and throughly read the book, it's no problem.  Info is also useful, as it pertains to everyday life.
Interesting
Lectures and movies are very interesting. She also puts her powerpoints on her website so it is great if you need to miss a class!
No Comments

Judith is nice, but can be a little short in person - although she's probably very busy. She makes the class itself fun, and very informative. Even though I didn't do well in the class, your ONLY grade is on 4 tests, one of which is dropped. Brings up a lot of very helpful information which actually can be used on your friends/enemies!
No Comments
